story.text: (Adds details)Jan 3 (Reuters) - Banc of America Securities downgraded Applebee's International Inc. APPB.O and three other restaurant chain operators saying it expects sales challenges for casual dining firms and potential margin pressures. The brokerage cut Applebee's to "sell" from "neutral" and lowered Ruby Tuesday Inc. RI.N, Brinker International Inc. (EAT.N) and Texas Roadhouse Inc. (TXRH.O) to "neutral" from "buy." It left unchanged its $21 price target on Applebee's and said the shares were currently overvalued. The brokerage cut Texas Roadhouse's price target to $15 from $17, citing risks from casual dining sales. Banc of America maintained its price targets of $31 and $29 on Brinker and Ruby Tuesday, respectively. (Reporting by Nitya Rao in Bangalore)
